lines.gurmukhi: Awn hwt ky htUAw lyq hY Gtwie mol dyq hY cVwie fhkq joeI AwvY jI
lines.transliteration_english: Aan Haat Kay Hatooaa Layt Hai Ghataai Mola , Dayt Hai Charhaai Dahakat Joee Aavai Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: When a shopkeeper or a trader approaches another but a clever shopkeeper, the later sells his merchandise at a profit and manipulates to buy other's goods at a lesser price.

lines.gurmukhi: iqn sY bnj kIey ibVqw n pwvY koaU totw ko bnj pyiK pyiK pCuqwvY jI
lines.transliteration_english: Tin Sai Banaj Keeay Birhataa N Paavai Kooo , Totaa Ko Banaj Paykhi Paykhi Pachhoutaavai Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Dealing with such deceitful shopkeepers cannot be profitable. Every trader repents at conducting a deal at a loss.

lines.gurmukhi: kwT kI hY eykY bwir bhuirE n jwie koaU kpt ibauhwr kIey Awpih lKwvY jI
lines.transliteration_english: Kaatth Kee Hai Aykai Baari Bahuriao N Jaai Kooo , Kapat Biuhaar Keeay Aapahi Lakhaavai Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a wooden pot can be used for cooking only once, similarly he who indulges in cheating in business exposes his self through his deceitful dealings.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur swh gun byc Avgun lyq suin suin sujs jgq auiT DwvY jI ]461]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Saah Goun Baych Avagoun Layta , Souni Souni Sujas Jagat Outthi Dhaavai Jee ?461?

Shabad OS B.translation: Contrary to the dishonest and deceitful trading, the True Guru is the truthful trader of true commodity. He sells the commodity of Lord's name to the Sikhs who come to trade with Him. In the bargain, He takes away from them all the sins and vices that the
